intro: Onosma setosa f. granatensis, commonly known as the Granatense hedge mustard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, and the flowers are usually pale yellow to white, arranged in racemes. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and grasslands.
